Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

In the text below, text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.

This landmark is an advanced energy sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{EnergyFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{EnergySlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{ProductionFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ProductionSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000359]Cryo-Medical Facility[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced energy sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{EnergyFlat}, {EnergySlot}.[br/]{ProductionFlat}, {ProductionSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD00000359]Cryo-Medical Facility[/hyperlink]

This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{ProductionFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ProductionSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{ResearchFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ResearchSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000032B]Heavy Duty Manufacturing Plant[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{ProductionFlat}, {ProductionSlot}.[br/]{ResearchFlat}, {ResearchSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD0000032B]Heavy Duty Manufacturing Plant[/hyperlink]

This landmark is an advanced research sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/][bulletList][bullet]{ResearchFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ResearchSlot} [/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{EnergyFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{EnergySlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000033A]Shrine of Darkness[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced research sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{ResearchFlat}, {ResearchSlot}.[br/]{EnergyFlat}, {EnergySlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000033A]Shrine of Darkness[/hyperlink]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{FoodFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{FoodSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{ResearchFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ResearchSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000335]Genetics Lab[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{FoodFlat}, {FoodSlot}.[br/]{ResearchFlat}, {ResearchSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000335]Genetics Lab[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{ProductionFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ProductionSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{EnergyFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{EnergySlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000369]Spaceship Maintenance Bay[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{ProductionFlat}, {ProductionSlot}.[br/]{EnergyFlat}, {EnergySlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD00000369]Spaceship Maintenance Bay[/hyperlink]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{FoodFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{FoodSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{HappinessFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{HappinessSlot} [/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following to be built in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000365]Relaxation Center[/hyperlink][/bullet][Bullet][hyperlink,0000038500000313]Roy-2[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000038500000314]Emma-3[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{FoodFlat}, {FoodSlot}.[br/]{HappinessFlat}, {HappinessSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following to be built in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD00000365]Relaxation Center[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000038500000313]Roy-2[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000038500000314]Emma-3[/hyperlink].

This landmark is an advanced research sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{ResearchFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ResearchSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{FoodFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{FoodSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000035D]Imperial Training Center[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced research sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{ResearchFlat}, {ResearchSlot}.[br/]{FoodFlat}, {FoodSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD0000035D]Imperial Training Center[/hyperlink]

This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{ProductionFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ProductionSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{EnergyFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{EnergySlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000326]Weapons Facility[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{ProductionFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ProductionSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{EnergyFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{EnergySlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000326]Weapons Facility[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{FoodFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{FoodSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{HappinessFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{HappinessSlot/}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000330]Starlight Observatory[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced food sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{FoodFlat}, {FoodSlot}.[br/]{HappinessFlat}, {HappinessSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD00000330]Starlight Observatory[/hyperlink]

This landmark is an advanced energy sector, and gives the following when annexed:[bulletList][bullet]{EnergyFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{EnergySlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]{ProductionFlat}[/bullet][bullet]{ProductionSlot}[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000304]Rift Generator[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

This landmark is an advanced energy sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{EnergyFlat}, {EnergySlot}.[br/]{ProductionFlat}, {ProductionSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD00000304]Rift Generator[/hyperlink]

An old Star Union sector base which is still operational. It acts as a pre-built food exploitation and provides an additional {SupplyFlat} and {SupplySlots}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD000004B2]Nutrition Center[/hyperlink]
Star Union is the name of the empire in our game, see the lore.

An old Star Union sector base which is still operational. It acts as a pre-built energy exploitation and provides an additional {EnergyFlat} and {EnergySlots}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD000004AC]Shielding Laboratory[/hyperlink]

An old Star Union sector base which is still operational. It acts as a pre-built production exploitation and provides an additional {ProductionFlat} and {ProductionSlots}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD000004B7]Reinforcement Factory[/hyperlink]

An old Star Union sector base which is still operational. It acts as a pre-built research exploitation and provides an additional {ResearchFlat} and {ResearchSlots}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003BD000004AD]Learning Center[/hyperlink]

An old naval Star Union sector base which is still operational. It acts as a pre-built water exploitation and provides an additional {EnergyFlat}, {ResearchFlat} and {FoodFlat} as well as and {EnergySlots}, {ResearchSlots} and {FoodSlots}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony:[hyperlink,000003BD00001921]Aquatic Training Facility[/hyperlink]

A memorial hall honoring revered heroes of the Star Union, monolythic and impressive these structures inspired a reverence of the Star Union's veterans.[br/][br/]Grants {Supply} Food and {Production} Production to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Non-Mindless units built in the owner colony gain {UnitBonus}.

An massive Heavy Weapons Factory, this massive complex once built many of the Star Union's heavy military equipment, now it is derelict, waiting to be looted.[br/][br/]Grants {Production} Production to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Heavy units built in the owner colony gain {UnitBonus}.
This unit's weapons have been modified to deal {Damage} damage during their next combat.
Restores full [hp/] to visiting units and grants them {Damagebonus} bonus damage on attacks during their next combat.[br/][br/]The Resupply Station adds {Supply} Food to the colony it is linked to.
The Union's Stadia still play automated concerts of long-forgotten bands. Grants {happiness} Happiness to the colony it is linked to.
Fully restores all move points of visiting units.[br/][br/]The Milestone Charge Station adds {energy} Energy to the colony it is linked to.

Despite the Star Union's ban on psionics and persecution of it's practitioners, shrines like this can be found defiantly hidden all over the Star Union's territories.[br/][br/]Grants {Research} Research and {Energy} Energy to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Units built in the linked colony gain {UnitBonus} Psionic Resistance.

An old Imperial Seed vault, used to store DNA samples and seeds of all varieties of creatures and vegetation for research purposes. [br/][br/]Grants {Research} Research and {Supply} Food to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Biological and Cyborg units built in the linked colony gain {UnitBonus}.

An old, abandoned terraforming outpost that still has some supplies left, including some imperial-grade stimulants that boost the immune system.[br/][br/]Grants {Supply} Food to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Units built in the linked colony gain {UnitBonus} Status Effect Resistance.
Imperial-grade stimulants are a kind of drug you can inject yourself with to boost your immune system / resistance
All units gain {UnitBonus} status effect resistance.

The Star Union maintained a strong planetary communication and propaganda network. During the empire's prime, these towers allowed for interplanetary communication as well. [br/][br/]Grants {Influencegain} Influence to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Units built in the linked colony gain {UnitBonus} accuracy on their attacks.
Resource node description. Autonom are an NPC faction of robots

Though the Paragon maintain a sizable military despite the Star Union's decline, these facilities serve as a reminder of the power the Paragon's legions used to maintain. [br/][br/]Grants {Energy} Energy and {Production} Production to the colony it is linked to.[br/]Light units built in the linked colony gain {UnitBonus}.
Resource node description. Paragon are an NPC faction
Gravity Generators are used as a non-combat deterrent to both enemy forces and wildlife.

[bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] movement cost in this sector is increased by {MovementCost} per hex on the world map.[/bullet][bullet]In combat:[/bullet][bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] units have [abilityred]Slow[/abilityred] movement speed.[/bullet]

Slow movement speed means the unit has less move points and moves slower on the world map. A hex has a movepoint cost(movement cost), and a unit has a number of move points. A unit spends movepoints equivalent to a hex's movepoint cost to move unto that hex.
Due to an active gravity generator in the sector, this unit has its gravity artificially increased. It has slow movement speed.
All units have slow movement speed due to an active Gravity Generator in the sector.
Targeting Arrays are used to get accurate locations of force movements for a tactical advantage.

[bulletList][bullet]Vision and sensor range for units in this sector is increased by {sensorRange}.[/bullet][bullet][abilityblue]Friendly[/abilityblue] units gain Detection.[/bullet][bullet]In combat, ranged abilities from [abilityblue]friendly[/abilityblue] units gain {accuracybuff} and {rangebuff} hex range.[/bullet]

Due to a targeting array boosting this unit, this unit gains the following: [bulletList][bullet]its vision and sensor range is increased by {sensorRange} hexes.[/bullet][bullet]It gains detection.[/bullet][bullet]This unit's Ranged abilities gain {accuracybuff} and {rangebuff} hex range.[/bullet]
Detection allows units to see other units that would otherwise be camouflaged and invisible.
This unit gains Detection from the targeting array.
Ranged abilities from [abilityblue]friendly[/abilityblue] units gain {accuracybuff} accuracy and {rangebuff} hex range.
Operation points are a resource that is spent to cast operations.
Operational Scramblers were often used by the Empire to block areas from counter intelligence operations and spying satelites.
[bulletList][bullet]Operations are not possible in this sector, both on the world map and in tactical combat.[/bullet]
Operations are not possible in this sector due to an active Operation Scrambler in the sector.
Pulse Defense Turrets are advanced anti-vehicle turrets that can disable and take out an enemy's heavy fire support at range.

[bulletList][bullet]In combat, every {turns}turns:[/bullet][bulletList][bullet]All [abilityred]enemy[/abilityred] Mechanical and Cyborg units suffer {TCdamage} Arc damage.[/bullet][bullet][abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] Mechanical and Cyborg units have a strength {Stunchance} chance to be [abilityred]Stunned[/abilityred] for {Stunduration}.[/bullet]
Mechanical and Cyborg are unit types, that determine whether or not some abilities and status effects can affect them. Stunned is a negative status effect that makes a unit unable to move or act.

Every {turns} turns, the battlefield is struck by an Arc pulse, dealing {TCdamage} Arc damage to all [abilityred]enemy[/abilityred] Mechanical and Cyborg units with a strength {Stunchance} chance to cause [abilityred]Stunned[/abilityred] for {Stunduration}.
This unit is engaged by the Pulse Defense Turret in this sector. Their world map regeneration is blocked.
regeneration is the amount of hit points (hp) that a unit regains each turn on the world map.
The ADS is found near areas of controlled airspace to discourage any adventurous interpretation of airspace borders. They are highly effective in dealing with any airborne presence.

[bulletList][bullet]In combat, every {turns} turn: [/bullet][bulletList][bullet]A random [abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] Flying unit suffers {TCdamage} Kinetic damage and the Turbulence debuff for {turnsTurbulence} turns.[/bullet]
Turbulence is a negative status effect that affects flying units, making them less accurate with their attacks.
This unit is engaged by the Aerial Denial System in this sector. Their world map regeneration is blocked.
Every turn, a missile will target a random [abilityred]enemy[/abilityred] Flying unit, dealing {TCdamage} Kinetic damage and applying the Turbulence debuff for {turns} turns.
This uplink was originally created to allow for constant communication with the planet's orbital defense platform. It is still active and targeting hostile forces in this sector.

[bulletList][bullet]In combat, every {turns} turns:[/bullet][bulletList][bullet]{units} random enemy units suffer {TCdamage} Kinetic damage.[/bullet][bullet]Non-resistant units will become [abilityred]Staggered[/abilityred].[/bullet]
Stagger is a negative effect that can be applied to enemy units that means they are less effective.
The battlefield is bombarded every {turns} turns, dealing {TCdamage} Kinetic damage to {units} random enemy units and causing [abilityred]Stagger[/abilityred].
This unit is engaged by the Orbital Defense Uplink in this sector. Their world map regeneration is blocked.

The Shroud Generator is an ancient Imperial device that was used by the military to deny vision and intel to enemy forces. Special equipment can negate the effects of the shroud generator, providing forces using them an advantage in combat.

[bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] units have {VisionRange} vision range while in this sector.[/bullet][bullet]In combat:[/bullet][bulletList][bullet]Units without Detection have the maximum range of all of their abilities reduced to {WeaponRangeTC} hexes.[bullet/]
Vision range is how far a unit can see on the world map. It gets reduced in sectors with the Shroud Generator.
[abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] units without Detection have the maximum range of all of their abilities reduced to {WeaponRangeTC} hexes.
This unit is engaged by the Shroud Generator in this sector. Their world map regeneration is blocked.

This will leave a razed version of this structure, which can be rebuilt later if you own the sector containing the structure. A razed version of this structure will have none of the listed effects active.
[abilityred]This structure has been razed, and currently none of its effects are active.[/abilityred]If you own the sector, you may restore this structure, reactivating its effects and benefits.
Restore this structure to its original form, reactivating its effects upon completion.
edit: removed will and added reactivating
This structure is currently being rebuilt. Completion in [INT_duration].
This Star Union era Teleport Station is still functional. Use it to find out where it leads.[br/][br/]The Teleport Station adds {energy} when it is within a colony's domain.
Go to the facility to which this station is connected.

The vault is a treasure trove of valuable data. By dedicating researchers to delving the archives, our Promethean technologies will benefit greatly.[br/][br/]Promethean tech is {ResearchReduction} cheaper to research, and Promethean units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.[br/][br/][orange]Can only be used by Promethean commanders[/orange]
Promethean units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.

The sanctorum contains many dark secrets. By dedicating researchers to delving the archives, our Psynumbra techologies will benefit greatly.[br/][br/]Psynumbra tech is {ResearchReduction} cheaper to research, and Psynumbra units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.[br/][br/][orange]Can only be used by Psynumbra commanders[/orange]
Psynumbra units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.

The complex is a treasure trove of valuable data. By dedicating researchers to delving the archives, our Voidtech research will benefit greatly![br/][br/]Voidtech is {ResearchReduction} cheaper to research, and Voidtech units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.[br/][br/][orange]Can only be used by Voidtech commanders[/orange]
Voidtech units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.

The archives contain both wisdom and light. By dedicating researchers to delving the archives, our Celestial techologies will benefit greatly![br/][br/]Celestial tech is {ResearchReduction} cheaper to research, and Celestial units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.[br/][br/][orange]Can only be used by Celestian commanders[/orange]
Celestial units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.

If we integrate this Synthesis network with our research centers, our Synthesis techologies will benefit greatly.[br/][br/]Synthesis tech is {ResearchReduction} cheaper to research, and Synthesis units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.[br/][br/][orange]Can only be used by Synthesis commanders[/orange]
Synthesis units cost {EnergyReduction} less [energy/] to produce.

The lab contains a wealth of experimental viruses and tissue samples. By dedicating researchers to exploring the material, our Xenoplague techologies will benefit greatly.[br/][br/]Xenoplague tech is {ResearchReduction} cheaper to research, and all spawned Xenoplague units gain {HealthPoints} multiplied with their tier.[br/][br/][orange]Can only be used by Xenoplague commanders[/orange]
This unit has gained {HealthModefier} as a result of discoveries made by researching old Xenotech samples.

By integrating the spaceport's satellite network systems with our own tactical networks, we can make pinpoint tactical strikes with far greater speed and efficiency.[br/][br/]The energy cost of tactical operations is reduced by {EnergyReduction}. In addition, tactical operations can now be deployed in the first turn of combat.
tactical operations are kind of like spells a player can use in combat.

Trips to the Elysium Park were renowned for their ability to restore the morale and vitality of the most miserable souls. We could embed 'assets' from the park with our military units, greatly boosting morale and vitality.[br/][br/]All non-Mindless units gain {AddedMorale}. Biological and Cyborg units also gain {hitPointsPoints}.

The governance palace is at the heart of a planetary communications network that we can use to spread propaganda across the globe, greatly increasing our international standing.[br/][br/]You gain {AddedReputation} and {AddedRelation} relations with all races.

The population of the cryo facility has been asleep for a long time, but with sufficient energy and preparation they could be brought back en masse to repopulate our colonies. However, our own citizens may not be pleased with this move…[br/][br/]Target colony instantly gains {AddedPopulation}, but also suffers from Major Unrest ({HappinessModefier}) for {Turns}.
You were successful in waking up some of the population sleeping in the cryo facility. However, your population is not pleased with this move and will be unhappy for some time.

At the start of each of the defender's turns, the Government Palace's regency engine chooses a random defending unit as its champion, granting it {ChampionProtocolDefense} damage resistance and {ChampionProtocolDamageBoost} increased damage on all abilities.
This unit has been chosen as a champion, granting it {ChampionProtocolDefense} damage resistance and {ChampionProtocolDamageBoost} increased damage on all abilities.
Every {turns}[turn/], more of the cryo facility's denizens awaken, summoning {AwakenedGuardiansNumber} Paragon Troopers or Guards for the defender until the end of combat.
Paragon troopers are like cyborg zombie soldiers, can be assumed male Paragon Trooper and Paragon Guards are the unit names.
Every {turns}[turn/], the defenders resupply from the space port, gaining stacking {armor}, healing them for {Healing} and resetting their ability cooldowns.

Defenders have {MeritsOfBlissCritBonus} increased critical hit chance. Every {turns}[turn/], the entrancing atmosphere of the Elysium Parks takes hold. Attacking units have a strength {HalucinationStrength} chance to start [abilityred]Hallucinating[/abilityred] for {HalucinationDuration}[turn/].
Hallucinating is a negative status effect that cause units to be unable to act for a duration.
Dark Sanctorum: Call of the Abyss

Every {turns}[turn/], the Abyss calls to all. Non-Mindless attacking units have a strength {CallOfTheAbyssStrength} chance to become [abilityred]Filled with Despair[/abilityred] until the end of combat. If resisted, they suffer [abilityred]Broken Mind[/abilityred] for {BrokenMindDuration}[turn/] instead.
Filled with despair and Broken mind are negative status effects. They are psychological and affect the mind.

Every {turns}[turn/], Celestian favor aids the defense. Attacking units have a strength {CelestianFavorSoulblazeStrength} chance to suffer [abilityred]Soulburn[/abilityred] until the end of combat. Defending units gain [abilityblue]Enlightened[/abilityblue] and are healed for {CelestianFavorHeal}.

Soulburn is a negative status effect that affects the enemy's soul. Enlightened is a postive status effect that means that the unit is following the Path of Light of the celestian, a religion type thing.

Every {turns}[turn/], the vault's purification protocols initialize, choosing {PurificationProtocolsTargetNumber} random hostile targets, dispersing PyrX gas to those and adjacent hexes. Biological and Cyborg ground units caught in the cloud are inflicted with [abilityred]Choking[/abilityred]. After {Timer}[turn/], the cloud explodes, dealing {ExplDamage} damage with [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred].
Immolated is a negative status effect. Immolated means covered in fire, taking fire damage every turn and running around in a panic (as you do)

The adaptive nature of the Synthesis network grants all defending units [abilityblue]Integrated[/abilityblue] and [abilityblue]Adaptive Network[/abilityblue] granting them {AdaptiveNetworkBuff} whenever they take damage. This can stack up to {stacks} times.
Integrated is a positive status effect, that means the unit is connected via cybernetic implants to a network. Adaptive network is a positive status effect as well.
This unit gains {AdaptiveNetworkShields} whenever it is damaged. This can stack up to {stacks} times.
This unit has gained {AdaptiveNetworkShields} in response to recently sustained damage. This can stack up to {stacks} times.

Every {turns}[turn/], the unstable systems of the Voidtech complex create an Unstable Echo of a random unit. Unstable Echoes deal 50% less damage, but are otherwise indistinguishable from the original.

Every {turns}[turn/], the infectious vapors of the Xenoplague infect a random attacking unit. That unit takes {InfectiousVapoursDamage} damage, with a strength {InfectiousVapoursStrength} chance to suffer [abilityred]Unstable Contamination[/abilityred] and [abilityred]Parasitic Infection[/abilityred] for {InfectiousVaporsTurns}[turn/]. The effect jumps to another target within {InfectiousVapoursJumpRange} hexes up to {InfectiousVapoursJumpMax} times.

Unstable Contamination is a negative status effect which poisons the unit, dealing damage over time. Parasitic infection lowers the resistances of a unit. This effect can 'jump' meaning it can go from one unit to another, crossing empty hexes in combat.
